alert.note: Alert for Florence; Forest; Langlade; Lincoln; Oneida; Vilas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 05 at 2:42PM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...FREEZING DRIZZLE MAY IMPACT TRAVEL THROUGH LATE AFTERNOON.. Surface observations suggest freezing drizzle or freezing mist continue from Lincoln and Langlade counties north into Vilas, Forest, and Florence counties at mid-afternoon. Freezing drizzle is expected to continue at times through the end of the afternoon from Merrill and Antigo northward to the Upper Michigan border. After the sun sets, a glaze of ice may form on untreated surfaces, which could make roadways slippery. The freezing drizzle should come to an end early this evening. Light snow is expected to develop over north-central Wisconsin this evening. Slippery stretches on area roads could also develop from the light snowfall. An inch or two of accumulations is possible generally north of a Rhinelander to Iron Mountain line by 6 am Saturday. Motorists should be alert for slippery and icy spots and are urged to slow down and allow extra time to reach their destination.

area.areaDesc: Florence; Forest; Langlade; Lincoln; Oneida; Vilas
